query: <s> what did user interface think about the technical function design of the new remote control ?
answer: user interface : i think one that does n't have lots of superfluous functions . like i 've got one at home that has well , apart from the obvious , channels , channel up , channel down , volume , marketing : yeah . user interface : you know , subtitles , mute , there 's a lotta buttons that i 've got no idea what they do , like . project manager : marketing : well , that 's a really good point , project manager : okay . marketing : because i think one of the things that being somewhat computer literate , we tend to um go to menus and then make choices , you know , so if it 's like an uh volume button , you know , you can go in and say mute or or volume . we do n't need to have like the l the numbers if we also have uh uh channel up channel down . project manager : mm . okay .
